element_texts.text: Completed

Seeger, Pete [no date]
Dear Jack-
Many thanks for letter and enclosures. Unfortunately, schedule this year pretty booked up. However, am forwarding your letter to man who books these tours for me, and if anything is open, he will contact Slim. All of my very best wishes - and with apologies for haste Pete Seeger
Completed

Box 452 Beacon. NY
Dear Jack Conroy - This is a long overdue thank you - but the appreciation is all the more from our children - (Mama's very tired - I know Slappy by
Completed
heart!) Danny - the 5'/2'er especially loved it - and it is an old enough book to grow up with him - In fact there's a loT he doesn't understand - buT it is teaching him -
Completed

Thank you again - books are so welcome up here in the country where the besT we geT is a 25¢ Golden -
Sincerely, Toshi Seeger (Mrs. Peter Seeger)
Completed

Shank, Max UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGO CIRCLE College of Liberal Arts and Sciences Department of Biological Sciences Box 4348, Chicago, Illinois 60680
Dec. 10, 1980
Dear Gladys and Josh, I've been wanting to write to you for months, but it's so hard to do. Mary died in 
May of a very fast-acting cancer. they got sick in Tanzania in February, but we thought it was just a tropical bug. However, it didn't respond to treatment, so she went in the hospital soon after we got home. I didn't want to stay in (Chicago?) for Christmas, so I drove to Florida and will wander around in the warmth looking at birds. Merry Christmas and love to you, Max
Completed

June 5, 1973
Dear Mr. Conroy - 
Ruth Prigozy suggested that I send you this copy of my book on Social Realism. Having grown up in that milieu, it was very interesting to (use to?) go over that material from a distance of thirty years. I hope you will enjoy reading Social Realism: Art as a Weapon. Yours Truly David Shapiro
Completed

Jimmy Sheridan 12 E. Chicago Ave Chicago 11, ILL
Jack (CLocker) CoNRoy 6012 So. Green STr. Chicago 21, ILL.
Completed

Dec. 9, 1953
Dear Jack
This note is to verify (your?) speaking date at (([Bedrosiam Salem in Euantor?]]). The date is Sunday Dec 20th she will call for you in her car at it is understood that I will make the pitch for the book. If (there's?) any (guest in?) call me at home or here at the office. Sincerely Jack Sheridan
Completed

Dear Jack, - 
I trust you received my previous cards and letters. And I hope you, Gladys and all of your heirs are doing well. For the past week I was going around with this notion that Frank (Meod?) was writing you and Gladys - At least it was his intention to pay you a visit. It was a real shocker to learn, that night, from Ruth that Frank left for England over a week ago. She sends her best wishes to you and Gladys. Sincerely Jimmy Sheridan [1968?]
Completed
Completed

of his position to get me out of scrapes with the local cops. For a while he was doing radio and J.V. scripts for (W.G.H.?). But for the past two years he confined himself to free lancing. Another literary personality who passed off the scene in the past month was Floyd Dell, famous for his novel 'Moon- Calf', and editorship of the New Mosses, during World War One - when Uncle Sam cracked down on it. I don't know whether Dell was sent to jail or not if my memory serves me right - I think the Government tried to put Dell & Max (Eastnon?) behind bars - but I don't know if it succeeded. Best of luck to you and Gladys and drop me a note when you're in the mood - I'm eagerly awaiting to see the birth of your Autobiography. 
Bye now Jimmy Sheridan
5427 No. (Henmre?) Ave Chicago, (?) 60640 Room 241
Completed

Jimmy Sheridan [1972]
Jack & Gladys, 
I want to thank you for your kind letter and the enclosed newspaper clipping on my father. He has many friends & loved ones who will feel a loss at his passing, but it's a comfort to me to know I'll be with him again.      Michaeline
